ul.li1: 1“I let myself be sought by those who did not ask;
ul.li2: I let myself be found by those who did not seek me.
ul.li1: I said, ‘Here I am; here I am!’ to a nation that did not call on my name;
ul.li2: 2I spread out my hands all day to a stubborn people,
ul.li1: those who walk after their thoughts in the way that is not good,
ul.li2: 3the people who provokeLiterally “provoking” me to anger continually to my face,
ul.li1: slaughtering for sacrifices in the garden,
ul.li2: and making smoke offerings on bricks,
ul.li1: 4who sitLiterally “sitting” in graves
ul.li2: and spend the night in secret places,Literally “watches”
ul.li1: who eatLiterally “eating” the flesh of swine
ul.li2: withOr “and” a fragmentThe reading tradition (Qere) has “broth” of impurity in their vessels,
ul.li1: 5who say,Literally “saying” “Keep to yourself!Literally “Come near to you”
ul.li2: You must not come near me, for I am too holy for you!”
ul.li1: These are a smoke in my nostrils,Literally “nose”
ul.li2: a fire burning all day.
ul.li1: 6Look! It is written before me: I will not be silent, but I will repay;
ul.li2: and I will repay inOr “on” the fold of their garment
ul.li1: 7your iniquities and the iniquities of your ancestorsOr “fathers” together, says Yahweh,
because they made smoke offerings on the mountains
ul.li2: and they taunted me on the hills,
ul.li1: I will measure their punishment from the beginning into the fold of their garment.”

chapter.p: 8Thus says Yahweh: “Just as the new wine is found in the cluster, and they say ‘You must not destroy it, for there is a blessing in it,’ so I will do for the sake of my servants byLiterally “to” not destroying everyone.Literally “all”

ul.li2: and my servants shall settle there.

15And you shall leave your name to my chosen ones as a curse,
ul.li2: and the Lord Yahweh will kill you, and he will giveLiterally “call” his servants another name.
ul.li1: 16Whoever blesses himself in the land shall bless himself by the God of trustworthiness,
ul.li2: and the one who swears an oath in the land shall swear by the God of trustworthiness,
ul.li1: because the former troubles are forgotten,
ul.li2: and they are hidden from my eyes.

ul.li1: 17For look! I am about to create new heavens and a new earth,
ul.li2: and the former things shall not be remembered,
ul.li1: and they shall not come to mind.Literally “go up to heart”
ul.li2: 18But rejoice and shout in exultation forever and ever over what I am about to create!
ul.li1: For look! I am about to create Jerusalem as a source of rejoicing,
ul.li2: and her people as a source of joy.
ul.li1: 19And I will shout in exultation over Jerusalem,
ul.li2: and I will rejoice over my people,
ul.li1: and the sound of weeping shall no longer be heard in it,

ul.li1: 20There will no longer be a nursing infant who lives only a fewLiterally “of” days,

ul.li1: 21And they shall build houses and inhabit them,
ul.li2: and they shall plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
ul.li1: 22They shall not build and another inhabit;
ul.li2: they shall not plant and another eat.
ul.li1: For the days of my people shall be like the days of a tree,
